item.description:
NEW HAMPSHIRE SERIES:
South Hancock and North Hancock ... Two 4,000-Footers!

EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran. Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882. PLEASE -- no calls except for day-of scheduling issues. You can text me as well. FINISH YOUR NH 48 4,000 LIST WITH US!


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS

Difficulty: 9.8 miles, 2,809' ASL climb; at a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 6 1/2-hour hike.

CLICK HERE: Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from our planned Hancock Campsite to the trailhead on the Kancamagus Highway (NH Route 112), near Lincoln, NH.


A view of Hancock Mountain as seen from the West Bond summit.



TRIP SUMMARY AND UPDATE (08/23/2010 7:30 a.m.): This trip is a cross-posted event between Hiking Mates CHALLENGE, the New England Hiking Meetup (NEHM) and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group, rescheduled (Yet again!) due to a strong rainstorm that swept in yesterday. Once again, the current plan is to meet directly at the Hancock Notch trailhead at the hairpin turn along the Kancamagus Highway ... as always, stay close to the website for updates. NOTE: This is a dog-friendly hike (i.e., Mike is going!).

This plan starts from the hairpin turn on the Kancamagus Highway and follows the Hancock Notch Trail left along the Cedar Brook Trail, then right onto the Hancock Loop Trail that visits both peaks. The Hancock Loop Trail is the only trail to Mount Hancock, a 4000-footer at the edge of the Pemigewasset Wilderness. It starts with old woods roads to the loop junction, climbs steeply to the north or south peak (depending on which fork you take), then follows a wandering path along the ridge to the other peak before descending back to the loop junction. The route up the north peak is rougher and steeper so many people like to go up that way and down the slightly better route from the south peak (clockwise along the loop).


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, sunscreen, bug repellent. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; trekking poles may be helpful gear for this hike.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

CLICK HERE FOR A TRIP PLANNER OF THE HIKE ROUTE -- PRINT AND TAKE A COPY WITH YOU (be sure to click the correct link at bottom, "N-S Hancock Only".


AREA OVERVIEW

TRAIL DESCRIPTIONS AND TRIP REPORTS
Link, Area Overview
Link, Area Overview, Hike the Whites
Link, SummitPost Page
Link, Appalachian Mountain Club Page

Link, Trail Description - Hancock Loop Trail

Link, Up-To-Date Trail Conditions



NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
